abstracts.cdata!:
This document provides a social
            assessment, and an Indigenous Peoples Plan (IPP) reflecting
            the socioeconomic conditions of local populations if the
            project's four states. The social assessment depicts an
            existing social participation strategy, with strong emphasis
            on social participation, community and municipal-level
            decision taking. The IPP details characteristics of the
            indigenous population, their social and cultural context,
            and defines ways to strengthen a socio-cultural
            participation strategy, specific for indigenous communities,
            and municipalities. One major finding indicates that
            indigenous communities' access to the benefits of the
            previous Municipal Project, have been more than
            proportional, but there are still demands for more
            information, and training, to improve subproject execution.
            This IPP includes additional training assistance for STU,
            and COPLADEMUN staff; implementation of diagnostic studies,
            and implementation of Municipal Social Plans, as a tool to
            prod economic development among indigenous populations.
            Monitoring and evaluation will be achieved through baseline
            studies, mid-term reviews on social participation
            assessments, and, statistical analysis of investment
            allocations among indigenous, and non-indigenous
            communities, to be encompassed by a final evaluation.
